author: @yapandasoftware
text: This method causes the sound to stop reading the rest of the argument. It stops right after the sound file is activated. It doesn't show an error in the debugger but it stops when the sound file is called. import tkinter as tk import tkinter.font import pygame from gpiozero import LED, Button from signal import pause from time import sleep  # import serial here  win=tk.Tk() win.wm_attributes("-topmost",1) win.title("ARBOR 4.0") myFont=tkinter.font.Font(family = 'Helvectica', size = 28, weight = "bold")  ## Set up Pins according to selection # however if serial connection can be made through ttyAMO or ttyUSB omit the pin selection and use serial events # then set up serial here led1 = LED(5) led2 = LED(6) led3 = LED(12) led4 = LED(13) limButton = Button(2)  #load sound files pygame.init() beep = pygame.mixer.Sound("beep.wav")  # limButton is the GUI which tells the person another floor is busy  def limButton():     while True:      if button.is_pressed:         limButton["text"]="System In Use"         break      else:         limButton["text"]="System Available"         break           def selectOption1():      if led1.is_lit:         led1.off()         led3.off()         paperButton["text"]="Paper"      else:         if plasticButton["text"] != "Please Wait!":              if glassButton["text"] != "Please Wait!":                  if refugeButton["text"] != "Please Wait!":                          limButton["text"]= "System in Use"                          pygame.mixer.Sound.play("beep") # it stops reading right here.. Why?                          led1.on()                          led3.on()                          paperButton["text"]= "Please Wait! While Diverter is Moving!"                          win.after(8000, delay_select1A) def delay_select1A():     paperButton["text"]= "Please Discard Recyclable Paper into Hopper!"     win.after(5000, delay_select1B)      def delay_select1B():         paperButton["text"]= "Thank You for Using CHG Recycling!"         win.after(3000, delay_select1B1)          def delay_select1B1():         paperButton["text"]= "When You Recycle you help the world!"         win.after(3000, delay_select1C)      def delay_select1C():     led1.off()     led3.off()     limButton["text"]= "System Available"     paperButton["text"]= "Paper"

author: @Steven-cl3gk
text: thanks a lot.  I face this problem. scale_1 = pygame.mixer.Sound('41.mp3')  pygame.error: Unable to open file 'beeps.wav'  try many ways but can't solve  finally i see this https://pythonprogramming.net/adding-sounds-music-pygame/  Notice the file is .wav. PyGame can handle .mp3 as well, but it is somewhat glitchy, and will work sometimes and other times it wont. For the safest bet, go with .wav.  i use wav, and problem solve. thanks!!!!
